summary:
Trilingual Dutch, French and English. Both French and Dutch nationality.

Fascinated by what (big) data and AI can offer, from historical towards current and in the end predictive and interchangeable data intelligence.

Experienced in Sales management, Business education, Software development, AI programmes, IT advisory work and Interim management. Specialist in Virtual 3DMMO worlds, communities and games. Translator French/English/German to Dutch. Lived and worked in Great Britain, France, Germany, currently living in the Netherlands.

Available for advice, sparring, brainstorming and other fun things people do to communicate about important subjects.

Nature and food lover, amateur chef, children and SF story writer; see EmmanuelGruijs on Instagram for some nice food and other. Married with English wife and living with our two young daughters and two cats.

"You don't need to think outside the box:  just make the box bigger"
Emmanuel

education.field_of_study: ICT, Paleography, Medieaval, Sciences occiliaires de l'histoire

projects.title: Virtual 3D Mondrian Museum
projects.description: Development and launch (March 7, 2015) of a new Mondrian museum that will in the near future contain ALL works and history of this great Dutch painter. This is the first multi-user virtual 3D museum in which thousands of visitors can walk through a museum together, discuss works with others, attend live discussions with specialist from all over the world and even open their own rooms with their favorite works.

contributors.headline: Business Advisor / Controller | Turn business opportunities into sustainable results by defining and managing the right KPIs. Transform data into information.

projects.title: Kunstvallei
projects.description: Great project for bringing together art and children in different ways, ranging from real life to completely virtual communities. The Twentse Welle and other known buildings are part of this 3D multi-user environment.

contributors.headline: SW and HW designer for HSWIM systems as an Independent  Contractor

projects.title: Superhelden.nl Children's book, Marcel van Driel
projects.description: Superhelden.nl is the second children's book of Marcel we have rebuilt in a multi-user 3D environment. His first book was Sprookjesspeurders, and working with him is always a great pleasure. Both worlds offer the possibility to replay the characters in the book and experience what they did, together with friends and others. His book and concept have been chosen as one of the few books children will be reading for school from 2013.

projects.title: TEDx virtual
projects.description:
What to do for all the people not being able to travel to the real location? That was the question we discussed with the Eduverse foundation.

Another fun project where everyone with a PC or laptop and internet connection could be present "live" with others in a large 3D auditorium and discuss presentations together.

Virtual visitors enjoyed sharing this, as it is much more personal than a webcast with a chat box underneath, and it saves a lot of travel time, CO2 and other annoying things.

projects.title: ABN AMRO Virtual collaboration
projects.description: After SecondLife, ABN decided to swap to Activeworlds for a collaboration world. Very nice project, involving different departments. The financial crisis put a halt to this project unfortunately.

contributors.headline: SW and HW designer for HSWIM systems as an Independent  Contractor

projects.title: Virtual Benelux
projects.description:
Due to many aspects, villages, neighbourhoods and other areas saw banks, legal services, post offices and other "vital" aspects of daily life disappear from their area. With the growing number of elderly people this sounds like a contradiction, but it is so.

Via NBL (www.nederlandbreedbandland.nl) we developed a concept to allow local inhabitants in a certain area to make use of those services via virtual 3D worlds in which both individuals and service providers could meet when needed, share documents, discuss subjects and make decisions.

The second goal was to prevent loneliness by offering a local environment where people can get together online and meet with their friends and relatives without having to walk or cycle or be pushed there. This also offered care services to monitor how people were doing.

The third goal was to offer thousands of unemployed and/or disabled people a virtual job. This has since become a new and on-going project.

projects.title: Ministry of Justice - Prison education
projects.description:
This project was part of an innovation lab for the Ministry of Justice, Prisons department. The lab contained many potential innovations to be used in prisons, ranging from toilets automatically analysing drugs or alcohol content to new tracing methods and virtual 3D worlds.

The film shows an inmate in prison for car theft who is given a job in a virtual city. Not only math and language skills can be honed, also social aspects play a large role. When the inmate even loses is job virtually, he wonders what he can do. Two passers-by talk to each other about the math building where they learned their skills. Who knows! could that work for him? And of course it does, and he is starting to become a working member of society.

Incredibly fun project with great people.

projects.title: Titanic3D
projects.description: Titanic3D was set up with a friend called Emmanuel Asset. His idea was to rebuild Titanic 3D in real size in a multi-user 3D world on the web. I decided to work with him and provided the technology. In 2005 we made headlines in most (EU) newspapers, were on TV and even on CNN world. Since, more than 3 million people have visited Titanic3D, and a new version was built for the Anniversary by various 3D artists from all overt the world. The ship can be visited via the web site.

projects.title: NV3D Virtual city for economy education
projects.description:
NV3D was set up with educational publisher NijghVersluys (now ThiemenMeulenhoff) offering a central virtual environment on the web, connected with their different curricula for different levels.

The environment became a virtual 3D city in which groups of students and teachers could together walk around, talk with each other and solve challenges, Each level of education had its own environment with representations of nine different companies (bank, estate agent, flower export company, government, unemployment agency, etc.), containing exercises allowing students to play a role in a company. A exam centre, cinema and research centre, and a central "Math building" offered all the basics of mathematics and economy with exercises teaching the concepts.

One of the most important aspects we noticed during the project and after launch is that not the students needed guidance, but the teachers. We organised several short evening courses for teachers with great success. The main idea was simple:

Let the students play, while you as a teacher set the boundaries and rules.

For instance: They can go online and do whatever they want, as long as for the next lesson, they have done exercise 1, 2 and 3 in the bank successfully.

A dashboard system was developed to allow all to see the results and progress at a glance and in depth. It allowed teachers to concentrate on specific skills for specific students.

This project also showed the way groups of students communicate and use them. Depending on the level of education and school, students would either help each other with exercises, or play "illegal street races" with the Porsche Avatars.

The method ran successfully from 2007 to 2012, with tens of thousands of students using it. Due to political, economical and merger factors, the system was unfortunately discontinued.

Also see Justice project.

courses.name: Many (compulsory) courses needed and expected for different roles
STARS (Strategic Account Reviewing System) at IBM, interesting and fun!

profile_positions.description: Gericht op mens-machine samenwerking. in 1983 eerste AI systeem gebouwd, sindsdien de waarde van de mens zien stijgen en getracht dezelfde mens te leren hoe en wat machines en software kunnen, en hoe we ermee om kunnen gaan. Dat verandert continu, vaak door een doorbraak. en hoe ga je met een doorbraak om? precies zoals je begon, met vernieuwd plezier.
profile_positions.title: Taaldenker

profile_positions.description:
- Strategic advice on use of virtual worlds, communities and 3D business
- Development of educational multi-user 3D projects
- Analysis of avatar movements and behaviour in virtual worlds
- Development of multi-user consumer and business simulation games
profile_positions.title: CEO and initiator

profile_positions.description:
Activeworlds Europe:
- European distributor of Activeworlds Inc. (USA, 1995) licenses and technology 
- Development of efficient and cost-reducing tools and solutions
- Hosting, maintenance and 24/7 mirroring solutions
- Public 3D environment for both consumer and professional

My own role is to continue to make Activeworlds (Europe) a profitable and growing company and technology, being a professional and reliable liaison officer and adviser to our existing and new customers, and a provider of sensible visionary solutions.

You are welcome to contact me in this or other roles.
profile_positions.title: European Distributor

company.name: UFE Netherlands (Union des Français a l'étranger Pays-Bas)

profile_positions.company: UFE Netherlands (Union des Français a l'étranger Pays-Bas)
profile_positions.description: The UFE is a union of French people in the Netherlands. Beside being an active network where people can find help from others, it also organises special events like Beaujolais, Oyster and other culinary festivities. Since I was 16, I enjoy going there and remember opening hundreds of oysters with the French Consul and other people who understand the importance of food. One of the things you should do at least once in your life.
profile_positions.title: Membre de UFE Pays-Bas

profile_positions.description:
Lid van de Beoordelingskamers en beoordelingscommissie Creatieve Industrie – ronde 2012, Kamer 1, GATHER (gaming) en Media & ICT.

Interessant traject waarin een goed beeld ontstaat van welke onderwerpen in aanvragen de nadruk hebben voor nu en de komende jaren. Ook genoten van het ontmoeten van zowel specialisten als generalisten, en hun visie op de verschillende onderwerpen en kwaliteit van onderzoek en ontwikkeling.

Een ervaring rijker.
profile_positions.title: De Nederlandse Organisatie voor Wetenschappelijk Onderzoek (NWO)

profile_positions.description: Consultant in ICT, Auditing and HRM, mostly worked in Banking, Insurance and Government in this position for customers like PVK, BCICT (Tax Office ICT) and other financial instances. I audited pension companies and developed testing schemes for internal and external auditing. I left Cap Gemini on my own account and with their help to start my own 3D web company AW Europe (Activeworlds Europe).
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description: Responsible for at first 35 people in one location and later 175 people in three locations for which I setup a team of Field managers. Financial responsibility around 10 Million NLG. After Brunel I left the company to go and live with my new-found wife in London. It is then that I discovered Activeworlds and started thinking about multi-user 3D possibilties. We both came to live in the Netherlands a year later when I was offered a job at Cap Gemini via a London agency.
profile_positions.title: Regional manager

profile_positions.description: Educational consultant and sales representative for (international) customers. (Co-)responsible for projects up to 40 million NLG. Most interesting projects were the worldwide training of 25,000 KPMG employees in the change from Apple to Windows within a scaringly short time span, and especially the R&D projects in IBM Education, which were far ahead of their time. I joined IBM because the company I worked for became part of IBM and I was offered an interesting job.
profile_positions.title: Education consultant

profile_positions.description:
Educational Sales, Curriculum developer, teacher.

This is where my love for education started: to teach others to enjoy the (new) way they have to, and can work.

Fabulous time and incredible technology, in the 80's they already had voice- and picture processing for in the office and were way ahead of IBM and others. A shame the old founder died, and his son let the company die. I left before what was left of Wang was sold to another company and development stopped. As without new developments, every day is a step back.
profile_positions.title: Educational Sales Consultant

profile_positions.description: Responsible for KLM Netherlands ICT systems mangement and development with a 6 person team. User base of around 600 people on different Wang mini systems.
profile_positions.title: Head of IT Support
